intro: Astracantha jankae, commonly known as the Janka's thornveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays an important role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
